channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: What We Played – Silksong, Cronos: The New Dawn and Indiana Jones – The Order of Giants
item.content:encoded:
Forget the weather or the date, you know we’re in a new season because of the games coming out. That’s right, it’s straight into silly season, with Silksong’s launch crashing all the console and PC stores yesterday, Hell Is Us, Cronos: The New Dawn and more! I’ll personally be making a start on Indiana Jones’ The Order of Giants DLC today.

But maybe it’s actually spooky game season already? I’d say it traditionally starts in October, but Laura has other ideas, as she’s been playing Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden. She says, “It’s fun switching between characters and I’m enjoying getting into Banishers lore. Plus Red has the most luscious Scottish accent, so what’s not to love?”

Adding weight to the spooky games in September theory is Steve, who’s reviewed Cronos: The New Dawn from Bloober Team – “I enjoyed it a lot and will play NG+ on when I find the time.” But time waits for no man, so he’s also been playing the “aggressively mediocre” Lost Soul Aside for review, a bit of Davy X Jones as it heads into Early Access, and has jumped into the classic action adventure of Otherskin. Ha, and he’s made a start on Silksong as well, so there’s that!

Aran has been continuing on with Wild Hearts and reckons he’s getting to the ending, so he’s grinding his way through gear upgrades before tackling the finale. Gringing away to improve his own skills is Ade, who’s sticking with Marvel Rivals, has joined a faction and is even thinking he might take part in an upcoming PlayStation Tournament thingy.

It’s been BlazBlue Entropy Effect for Jason, who says that “it slaps” and demands to know “Why did nobody tell me about it sooner?” He’s also been playing He Is Coming, but cannot get a win in the Kingmaker mode.

It’s been a struggle for Nic, who’s little one is poorly and had no time to play games because of it – I helpfully suggested Dr. Mario or the old Trauma Center games – and Gamoc’s also had a somewhat sucky time of it, but has snuck in some The Rogue Prince of Persia, Ghost of Tsushima, HIrogami and Discounty, albeit only in smaller doses.

And finally, Dom has played some Madden 26 and Star Wars: Outlaws on Switch 2, and you’ll soon get to read about just how impressed he is with the latter this afternoon, while Jim played some Sword of the Sea which, “to nobody’s surprise, is a cross between Journey and ABZU.”

Now then, what have you been playing?



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/05/what-we-played-silksong-cronos-the-new-dawn-and-indiana-jones-the-order-of-giants/

item.title: Street Fighter movie has begun filming, release date set for October 16th 2026
item.content:encoded:
Capcom has announced that filming for the Street Fighter movie has started, and the release date is set for October 16th 2026. Capcom has partnered with Legendary Entertainment to finance the film’s production, and the studio has also confirmed the Street Fighter movie’s cast by releasing a new poster.

The Street Fighter movie cast includes:

  • Noah Centineo as Ken,
  • Andrew Koji as Ryu,
  • Callina Liang as Chun Li,
  • Joe “Roman Reigns” Anoai as Akuma,
  • David Dastmalchian as M.Bison,
  • Cody Rhodes as Guile,
  • Andrew Schulz as Dan Hibiki,
  • Eric André as Don Sauvage,
  • Vidyut Jammwal as Dhalsim,
  • Curtis “50 Cent” Jackson as Balrog,
  • Jason Momoa as Blanka,
  • Olivier Richters as Zangief,
  • Orville Peck as Vega
  • Hirooki Goto as E. Honda.

UFC fighter Alexander Volkanovski, actor Kyle Mooney, Cobra Kai actor Rayna Vallandingham, and Mortal Kombat actor Mélanie Jarnson have also been confirmed for the Street Fighter movie, but their roles have not yet been confirmed.  Kitao Sakurai will be directing the movie, his previous directing credits include the 2021 Netflix film Bad Trip, The Eric Andre Show, four episodes of Twisted Metal, the TV show Dave, and TV series The Premise.

Source: Capcom



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/09/05/street-fighter-movie-has-begun-filming-release-date-set-for-october-16th-2026/
